title: Everyone has feelings
body:
It's common courtesy to anyone we meet in our games to not be a total jerk, _especially_ if they are making mistakes due to lack of confidence.

Just think about even the smallest impact you could make, it matters.

replies.body: i used to believe that until i started playing video games... some people REALLY make me doubt that theyre even human 8)

Remember to always coddle everyone you meet, and never say, do or reference anything for fear of offending their cuddly wuddly delicate little sensibilities. 

Remember to always dance through the streets with sprinkles and sunshine and always be in a good mood because if you do anything less than that, you are a bad person who might offend someone and make them sad boo hoo.

Punishing people for failure versus positive reinforcement when they are succeeding.

Well you can positively reinforce when they do good things, but when they're doing bad things the go to is punishment.

If only people actually remembered to employ positive reinforcement in equal parts to punishment. 

Some players sure love to focus on one side of that equation.

in the meantime, I will help you rediscover that little voice inside. The one that loves you: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-JZw6MS07XI
Chicken, stfu, you're not getting silver this season, even if you did silver doesn't equal sivir XD.
I am not aiming for silver but thank you for reminding me :P

Usually, when people start raging I just tell them to stop. If they keep going, that means they're frustrated IRL so I don't bother and mute them. It's better to let them rage in game rather than having a murder or some crazy stuff going on IRL. Somehow, people relieve everything on the Rift cause "it's not them shooting a gun".
If you want to insult someone, call them a Dumb Bear (courtesy of our friend SkyWilliams) :)
I like the idea of "common courtesy". It's been lost in the online landscape.

But that's not true, not everyone has feelings.

You could be a sociopath.
